description: The study of how cells acquire, transform, and utilize energy - the foundation of all life processes
core_concept: Life defies entropy through constant energy input to maintain complex, organized structures

sections.section_title: The Central Role of Energy in Life
sections.key_concept: Energy is the capacity to cause change or do work in biological systems

types_of_cellular_work.description: Driving endergonic reactions and synthesizing complex molecules
Pumping substances across membranes against concentration gradients
Causing physical movement at cellular and molecular levels

thermodynamic_laws.statement: Energy can be transferred and transformed, but cannot be created or destroyed
thermodynamic_laws.biological_implication: Cells transform energy from one form to another but do not create it; plants convert solar energy to chemical energy

thermodynamic_laws.statement: Every energy transfer increases the entropy (disorder) of the universe
thermodynamic_laws.biological_implication: Cells maintain internal order by increasing environmental disorder through heat release and waste production

sections.key_concept: Gibbs Free Energy (G) determines reaction spontaneity and energy requirements

free_energy_components.definition: Gibbs Free Energy (G) - portion of system's energy available to do work

reaction_types.energy_flow: Products have less free energy than reactants
Products have more free energy than reactants

function.mechanism: Energy coupling - using exergonic ATP hydrolysis to drive endergonic processes

atp_cycle.purpose: Releases energy to power cellular work
Regenerates ATP using energy from catabolic reactions

sections.definition: Series of enzyme-catalyzed chemical reactions that manage energy flow in cells

pathway_types.function: Break down complex molecules into simpler ones
pathway_types.energy_flow: Release energy, some used to synthesize ATP

pathway_types.function: Build complex molecules from simpler ones

sections.relationship: Catabolism provides energy and building blocks for anabolism - the processes are coupled

sections.purpose: Speed up metabolic reactions by lowering activation energy

activation_energy.definition: Energy barrier (Eₐ) that must be overcome for a reaction to occur
activation_energy.enzyme_effect: Enzymes lower the activation energy, increasing reaction rate

key_properties: Do not change ΔG - only affect reaction rate

sections.section_title: Big Picture - Energy Flow in Living Systems

energy_flow_pathway.description: Energy stored in chemical bonds of glucose
ATP powers all forms of cellular work
Enzymes catalyze and regulate every step

summary: Cellular Energetics describes the integrated system of energy transformation where solar energy flows through producers to consumers, constantly being transformed within every cell through coupled metabolic pathways to power all life processes.
